intro: Wyethia helianthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in the summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Wyethia helianthoides is often found in open areas like grasslands and disturbed soils.
